alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 5:01AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain with rates exceeding 3 inches per hour as a series of storms move over terrain. One gauge reported 0.5 inches in 20 minutes. Additional rounds of heavy rain are expected in the warned area. Rainfall rates and resulting runoff may briefly exceed capacity of ditches and small creeks or streams. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Adirondack Regional Airport, Clayburg, Loon Lake, Onchiota, Vermontville, Alder Brook, Union Falls, Riverview, Rainbow Lake, Hawkeye, Gabriels, Paul Smiths, Redford, Lake Clear, Chazy Lake, Upper Saint Regis and Upper St. Regis. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
